so_24843614: Execute process in background, without printing "Done", and get PID
Top-3 Scripts:
so_24843614: $ function x { for A in {1..100}; do echo "$A"; sleep 1s; done }
$ read pid < <(x & echo $!)
$ kill -s 0 "$pid" &>/dev/null && echo "Process active." || echo "Process died."
Process died.
$ read pid < <(x > /dev/null & echo $!)
$ kill -s 0 "$pid" &>/dev/null && echo "Process active." || echo "Process died."
Process active.

Explanations about Options.-s:
Specify the signal to be sent. The signal can be specified by using name or
 number. The behavior of signals is explained in signal(7) manual page.
